titles.title: DHS International Cyber Partner Act of 2024
DHS International Cyber Partner Act of 2024

To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to provide explicit authority for the Secretary of Homeland Security and the Director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency to work with international partners on cybersecurity, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Homeland Security, and in addition to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Homeland Security, and in addition to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Referred to the Subcommittee on Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection.
Subcommittee on Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Protection Discharged
Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
